questions.question_text:
You have a security system that analyzes images from CCTV to provide authorized staff entry into restricted area.

Which type of computer vision does the system use?

comments.content:
A - assigning the color pixels in an image to object names 
E - describing the contents of an image

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AE
A and E are correct

Selected Answer: AE
A&E
describing the content of an image requires understanding the objects, scenes, and relationships depicted in the image. This is what computer vision do

Selected Answer: AE
A and E
A and E

comments.content: Unfortunately, you are wrong. D is Generative AI

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
Options A&D

Create images is not an example of computer vision. Its an example of image generation. 

On the other hand, creating a textual description is computer vision. This is exactly what computer vision systems (like Azure Vision) can do, in addition to object detection, tagging, OCR, face detection, Semantic Segmentation and other similar services.

Selected Answer: AE
According to Microsoft Azure, computer vision can be used for a variety of tasks, including object classification, object identification, object tracking, and optical character recognition. To answer your question, the two workloads that can be performed by using computer vision are:

Assigning the color pixels in an image to object names.
Describing the contents of an image.
Therefore, the correct answers are A and E

Selected Answer: AD
You can use computer vision for the following workloads:

A. Assigning the color pixels in an image to object names.
D. Creating photorealistic images using three-dimensional models.

Computer vision is typically used for tasks like object detection, image recognition, and creating images from 3D models, as described in options A and D. It's not typically used for the other tasks mentioned in options B, C, and E.

comments.content: We are in the context of azure here. Image generation does not apply for computer vision.

discussion.content: the answer is correct

B- detecting inconsistencies and anomalies in a stream of data

are the corrects!

questions.question_text:
For which two workloads can you use computer vision? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.A: assigning the color pixels in an image to object names
choices.B: detecting inconsistencies and anomalies in a stream of data
choices.E: describing the contents of an image
choices.C: creating visual representations of numerical data
choices.D: creating photorealistic images by using three-dimensional models

questions.question_text:
You have an app that identifies the coordinates of a product in an image of a supermarket shelf.

Which service does the app use?

discussion.content: answer is correct
Correct answer is B

Object detection model returns the following information:
- The class of each object identified in the image.
- The probability score of the object classification (which you can interpret as the confidence of the predicted class being correct)
- The coordinates of a bounding box for each object.
Reference:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/detect-objects-images-custom-vision/1a-what-is-object-detection

Selected Answer: B
answer is correct

choices.A: Implement an Agile software development methodology
choices.D: Prevent the disclosure of the use of AI-based algorithms for automated decision making
choices.C: Establish a risk governance committee that includes members of the legal team, members of the risk management team, and a privacy officer
choices.B: Implement a process of AI model validation as part of the software review process

discussion.content: B and C are correct. B ensures reliability and safety principle and C ensures privacy and security principle of AI.

B and C

comments.content:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cloud-adoption-framework/innovate/best-practices/trusted-ai#accountability
Accountability is an essential pillar of responsible AI. The people who design and deploy the AI system need to be accountable for its actions and decisions, especially as we progress toward more autonomous systems. Organizations should consider establishing an internal review body that provides oversight, insights, and guidance about developing and deploying AI systems. While this guidance might vary depending on the company and region, it should reflect an organization's AI journey.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
BC is the answer.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cloud-adoption-framework/innovate/best-practices/trusted-ai#reliability-and-safety
AI systems need to be reliable and safe in order to be trusted. It's important for a system to perform as it was originally designed and for it to respond safely to new situations. Its inherent resilience should resist intended or unintended manipulation. Rigorous testing and validation should be established for operating conditions to ensure that the system responds safely to edge cases, and A/B testing and champion/challenger methods should be integrated into the evaluation process.

Selected Answer: BC
correct answer. B --> Safety and reliability, C --> Privacy and security
B - Reliability and Safety, C - Accountability

questions.question_text:
You are building an AI-based app.
You need to ensure that the app uses the principles for responsible AI.
Which two principles should you follow? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
